com.company

Class PlayingSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.company.PlayingSystem

  • public class PlayingSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the most important class in the structure of this game .It controls the process of playing such as changing turns , adding tokens , checking if there is a winning , checking if there is a tie , rotating blocks and computers playing functions .

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayingSystem()
      Makes a new playing system with 2 players .

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Checks if there is a winning or not .
      boolean checkTie()
      Checks if after a rotation , there is 2 different sequences of both colors and if there is no more available movements and no one has won .

      Checks if in the given location a token exits or not .

      Rotates a block in anti clock wise direction ; based on what block it is , it has a different algorithm to run so it is implemented for all four blocks .

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayingSystem

        public PlayingSystem()
        Makes a new playing system with 2 players . Players' colors are chosen randomly and each time it differs from the last time . It is assumed that player1 starts the game .

    • Method Detail

      • addNewToken

        public void addNewToken(int x,
                        int y,
                        java.lang.String unicode)
        Adds a new token to board . Check is the token is not already in the list and then adds it to list of all tokens and list of the block tokens the token is in .
        Parameters:
        x - x of new token
        y - y of new token
        unicode - color unicode of token

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Prints the board with tokens in it .

      • findBlock

        public int findBlock(int x,
                     int y)
        By giving x and y it find the block given location is in .
        Parameters:
        x - x of location
        y - y of location
        Returns:
        block number

      • printData

        public void printData()
        Prints data of playing system such as each block tokens and all tokens . It is used for debugging .

      • checkIfWin

        public boolean checkIfWin(java.lang.String unicode)
        Checks if there is a winning or not . It checks if there is any 5 tokens of the given string in the same line. That line can be straight , perpendicular , and 2 kinds of diagonal .All these kinds of lines are checked .
        Parameters:
        unicode - color unicode which we want to check winning of it
        Returns:
        true , if it has won and false if it has not .

      • checkTokenExistence

        public boolean checkTokenExistence(int x,
                                   int y)
        Checks if in the given location a token exits or not .
        Parameters:
        x - x of location to be checked
        y - y of location to be checked
        Returns:
        true if it exists and false if it doesn't exist .

      • getTokenUnicode

        public java.lang.String getTokenUnicode(int x,
                                        int y)
        Gets color unicode of a token in the given location . If there is no token there , returns an empty string .
        Parameters:
        x - x of location to be checked
        y - y of location to be checked
        Returns:
        color unicode string

      • rotateClockwise

        public void rotateClockwise(java.util.ArrayList<Token> blockTokens,
                            int blockNumber)
        Rotates a block in clock wise direction ; based on what block it is , it has a different algorithm to run so it is implemented for all four blocks .
        Parameters:
        blockTokens - Array list of tokens in that block
        blockNumber - number of block to be rotated

      • rotateAnticlockwise

        public void rotateAnticlockwise(java.util.ArrayList<Token> blockTokens,
                                int blockNumber)
        Rotates a block in anti clock wise direction ; based on what block it is , it has a different algorithm to run so it is implemented for all four blocks .
        Parameters:
        blockTokens - Array list of tokens in that block
        blockNumber - number of block to be rotated

      • setTurn

        public void setTurn(int turn)
        Sets turn to the given turn number .
        Parameters:
        turn - new turn number to be set

      • playTurn

        public void playTurn()
        Controls over turns changing process and change turns .

      • getTurn

        public int getTurn()
        Get current turn number .
        Returns:
        turn number

      • findUnicode

        public java.lang.String findUnicode(int turn)
        Gets turn number and find the color unicode string for the player playing .
        Parameters:
        turn - turn number
        Returns:
        color unicode string

      • getBlockTokens

        public java.util.ArrayList<Token> getBlockTokens(int blockNumber)
        Gets all tokens in specified block by using the given block number .
        Parameters:
        blockNumber - number of the block which we want the list of tokens in it
        Returns:
        Array list of tokens in that block

      • checkTie

        public boolean checkTie()
        Checks if after a rotation , there is 2 different sequences of both colors and if there is no more available movements and no one has won .
        Returns:
        true if there is a tie , and false if there isn't

      • printMenu

        public void printMenu()
        Prints the menu for the start of game .

      • playComputer

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> playComputer()
        Simple computer playing method which works randomly every time . Finds a random place to put a token (checks if it's empty) and random block and direction ro rotate .
        Returns:
        Array list of in order : x , y , block number , direction number (direction number : 1 is for clockwise and 2 is for anticlockwise)
